intro: Acetosella subacaulis, commonly known as the slender sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves contain oxalic acid, giving them a sour taste, and it is often found in calcareous soils. Acetosella subacaulis is relatively rare and can be an indicator of specific ecological conditions in its habitat.
